# usesRuler

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that controls whether the text views sharing the receiver’s layout manager use a ruler.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var usesRuler: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] to cause text views sharing the receiver’s layout manager to respond to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRulerView] client messages and to paragraph-related menu actions, and update the ruler (when visible) as the selection changes with its paragraph and tab attributes, otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Related Documentation

- **rangeForUserParagraphAttributeChange**: The range of characters affected by an action method that changes paragraph (not character) attributes.

## Using text formatting controls

- **isRulerVisible**: A Boolean value that controls whether the scroll view enclosing text views sharing the receiver’s layout manager displays the ruler.
- **usesInspectorBar**: A Boolean value that indicates whether this text view uses the inspector bar.
